newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian cotton mixed in moderate trade.
newsitem.headline: Indian cotton mixed in moderate trade.

text.p: Indian cotton was mixed on Wednesday with Punjab varieties rising while Gujarat was steady, dealers said.
Limited arrivals and shortage of ready stock led to some speculative buying which drove prices of Punjab varieties up but fresh mill buying was poor, they said.
In spot deals Punjab saw-ginned moved up by 25/30 rupees to 1,600/1,700 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) while F-414 rose to 1,900/1,925 rupees per maund from 1,885/1,905 rupees.
Bengal-deshi was 5 rupees higher at 885/935 rupees per maund.
Arrivals of cotton in the Punjab region dropped to 2,000/2,500 bales (170 kg each) from 4,000/5,000 bales on Tuesday, dealers said.
Gujarat cotton was steady in light trade, dealers said.
Gujarat Kalyan (medium-staple) was steady at 13,700/14,000 rupees per candy (355.56 kg).
The Bombay cotton market is closed on Thursday for a local holiday. It reopens on Friday.
